newsitem.title: UK: PRESS DIGEST - London-based Arab newspapers - Sept 4.
newsitem.headline: PRESS DIGEST - London-based Arab newspapers - Sept 4.

text.p: These are some of the leading stories in two London-based Arabic-language newspapers on Wednesday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
- Egypt approved 4,000 projects worth $14.8 billion in eight months.
- Jordan's Arab Bank posts $461 million net profit in the first half of 1996.
- Kuwaiti oil minister expects rise in oil prices after U.S. missile attack against Iraq.
- Saudi Pharmaceutical and Medical Appliance Co gets contracts worth 100 million riyals from Saudi Health Ministry.
- The International Monetary Fund approves Egypt's economic reforms programme.
- Saudi Finance Ministry starts to pay farmers and contractors seven billion riyals in arrears.
- World Bank gives Jordan a $20 million loan.
